definitions.definition: To exert for the sake of training or improvement ; to practice in order to develop .
examples: to exercise troops or horses;  to exercise one's brain with a puzzle

definitions.definition: To perform physical activity for health or training.
examples: I exercise at the gym every day.

definitions.definition: To use (a right, an option, etc.); to put into practice .
examples: The tenant exercised his option to renew the tenancy.
She is going to exercise her right to vote.

definitions.definition: To occupy the attention and effort of; to task; to tax, especially in a painful or vexatious manner; harass; to vex; to worry or make anxious.
To set in action; to cause to act, move, or make exertion; to give employment to.

main_definition: To exert for the sake of training or improvement ; to practice in order to develop .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To perform physical activity for health or training.
( transitive ) To use (a right, an option, etc.); to put into practice .
( now often in passive ) To occupy the attention and effort of; to task; to tax, especially in a painful or vexatious manner; harass; to vex; to worry or make anxious.
( obsolete ) To set in action; to cause to act, move, or make exertion; to give employment to.
